result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl R Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.

Concurrent with: Case 15CF522 BUT CONSECUTIVE to Case 14CF1445, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to the State of Missouri through the Interstate Compact if Missouri is willing to accept the defendant.
Concurrent with: Cases 14CF1445 and 15CF522.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied.  Balance of costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by the Agent.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Cases 15CF793 & 15CF932 were dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Daryl R Henderson in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   

State moves to amend the felony to a misdemeanor.
Defense has no objections.
Amended information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.


Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
Concurrent to:  Case 15CF522
Consecutive to:  Case 14CF1445
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to:  Case 14CF1445 & 15CF522
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Missouri through the interstate compact if Missouri is willing to accept him.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Anger Management or DV Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by the agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
Apply Left Over bail from 14CF1445 to this case.
Any Balance Owed To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Court quashes warrant.
